data.title: Saint Augustine Catholic Church
data.text:
To receive food you must make an appointment. The appointment system is to reduce your wait time.

No more waiting in long lines! Please park in the church parking lot. Food distribution will not take place in the alley.

We will be open every week. You can receive food once a week and must have an appointment every week.

We are excited to give the you the opportunity to come into the pantry and select the items you want and need.

For those of you who choose not to or are unable to come inside we can bring a box out to you in the church parking lot.

You will need an appointment for both options.

To make things easier for you. You can make your appointments right here. You now have two options to receive food, choose the one that works best for you:

Box Pick Up- A box of pre-selected items will be brought out to your car as you wait in the St. Augustine Church Parking lot.

No substitutions will be allowed. Click here to make an appointment for BOX PICK UP.

In Person- you get to enter the pantry and choose the items you want within posted limits.

Click here to make an appointment for IN PERSON

To make your visit at the Pantry faster complete your registration with Food Bank of the Rockies (Link2Feed).

Click here to complete registration: REGISTRATION

All clients must complete the Client Agreement. Please print out, read, sign and bring with you to your first appointment.

Click here for the CLIENT AGREEMENT.

If you need assistance with making an appointment please leave a message at 303-654-1040 or come in to the Pantry during open hours. Monday 12-2pm, Tuesdays 12-7pm.

There are many volunteer opportunities and an assortment of hours available! We have openings for everything and are most in need of bilingual volunteers! We encourage everyone from seniors to our youth to join us in serving those in need!

Volunteers are asked to come to a one hour orientation and tour. Click here to schedule an VOLUNTEER ORIENTATION.

At the orientation there are forms to fill out. If you would like you can print out the documents, read them, sign the forms and bring to the orientation.

Volunteer information Sheet

Volunteer Agreement

Hold Harmless form

Code of Conduct

USDA Civil Rights

DAYS and TIMES

Volunteers can select the dates and times that work best for their schedules. Most slots are in 2-hour or 3-hour increments. Volunteers are encouraged to sign up for multiple and sequential time slots if they choose.

To see slots and to sign up click here for the VOLUNTEER ONLINE SIGN-UP.

Monday: 9:00am- 11:30am, 11:30am –2:00 pm

Tuesday: 11:30am – 7:00pm (2 hour increments)

Friday: 7:00am – 9:00am

YOUTH Volunteers

The Food Pantry supports providing opportunities for youth volunteers in our community. Our primary focus is to help students in meeting requirements for High School graduation, National Honors Society, etc. We invite youth groups, and scouting troops to contact us regarding scheduling a time to come volunteer at the Pantry. Click here to EMAIL us for more information.

Youth between the ages of 14 and 17.

Sign up for orientation. Parents and students are required to come to orientation. Click here to sign up for VOLUNTEER ORIENTATION.

At the orientation there are forms to fill out. If you would like you can print out the documents, read them, sign the forms and bring to the orientation.

Volunteer information Sheet

Volunteer Agreement – Parent signature required

Minor Hold Harmless form

Code of Conduct

USDA Civil Rights

Youth 10-13 can work alongside their parents.

Sign up for orientation. Parents and youth are required to come to orientation. Click here to sign up for VOLUNTEER ORIENTATION.

At the orientation there are forms to fill out. If you would like you can print out the documents, read them, sign the forms and bring to the orientation.

Volunteer information Sheet (one for both parent and child)

Volunteer Agreement – (one for both parent and child)

Minor Hold Harmless form

Hold Harmless form

Code of Conduct (one for both parent and child)

USDA Civil Rights (one for both parent and child)

SAFP Food Distribution Policy

Volunteer Coordinator: Recruit, Train and Schedule Volunteers. Work with the Pantry Office Manager to maintain volunteer credentials. For more information email PantryOfficeManager@staugustinebrighton.org

Client Registration Coordinator: Work with clients to ensure complete registration, train Registration Assistants, Schedule Clients, Stay up to date and informed on registration software. Work with the Pantry Office Manager on reports. For more information email PantryOfficeManager@staugustinebrighton.org

Registration Assistant: Training Required. Assist Clients with Registration, Input data on iPad. Schedule clients. Completes training on Link2Feed.

Check Out Assistant: Perform customer product check out (like at a grocery store), explain and reinforce item limits, record data. Onsite Training Available.

Greeter: Welcome clients, Check in clients, Answer the phone, Direct client where to go for assistance. Onsite Training Available.

Personal Shopper: Assist clients going through the food distribution area, explain limits on items. Onsite Training Available.

Security: Stay visible to clients and volunteers, assist in any conflicts. Decompress situations.

Donation Sorter/Stocker: Sorting cans and boxed items, checking dates on products, stocking shelves. Onsite training available.

Box Builder: Tape Boxes, Fill boxes according to directions with food. Onsite Training Available.

Carry Out: Assist clients to carry their items to their cars in the parking lot. Shopping cart will be used. Onsite Training Available

Food Prep: Bag flour, beans and/or rice from large containers to individual containers. Onsite Training Available.

Drivers: Using your personal vehicle, pick-up products from a pre-arranged local store or restaurant. After contact with a store manager, you will load the product into your vehicle and transport it to the Food Pantry with delivery via the ally, and assist with unloading. VOLUNTEER DRIVER AGREEMENT with proof of driver license and insurance must be completed.

According to the Food Bank of the Rockies, “1 in 10 Coloradans worry where their next meal will come from. These are people you meet every day – those with low wage jobs, children, seniors on fixed income, those with health issues. Surprisingly, the homeless represent only 10% or our food recipients. Nearly half of the food we distribute feeds children.” The St. Augustine Community Food Pantry is a partner with the Food Bank of the Rockies, serving the Brighton community and Adams County.

If you are thinking of a community service project, please consider a food drive for your local food pantry. St. Augustine Community Food Pantry serves an average of 446 households per month (1862 individuals). Your assistance will make a difference.

The 100% volunteer staff is happy to assist you in planning a food drive with planning, promotional items, and pickup of collected items. Please contact us at PantryOfficeManager@staugustinebrighton.org or call at 303-654-1040 (message service, call will be return asap for information).

Thank you

Food Drive Planner

Food Drive Flyer
